Duangtawan Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 8038 reviews

Duangtawan hotel seems to be stuck in the '80s. Everything is huge - the 24-storey building itself, the lobby, the rooms, the bathrooms (.

.. except perhaps for the tiny elevators) -, but everything looks pretty old and in desperate need of refurbishment. Our room was really spacious, and the bathroom was as big as my bedroom back home in London - yet the furniture and the shower, bath tub and washing basin were decidedly decrepit, although functioning. The staff are efficient and friendly, but not particularly accurate: for example, the concierge made sure to have our luggage delivered to our room while we completed the check in (which was nice and much appreciated), but then, as I entered the room and decided to make myself a cup of tea, I realised that the cups were sticky and had not been washed properly! Similarly, one day we ran out of shampoo, but the cleaners forgot to replace it. One last tip: stay clear of the cocktails in the lobby/Marco Polo bar - they're atrocious!

Show more
Maddalena , United Kingdom
U Nimman Chiang Mai
9 Excellent
Based on 291 reviews

I stay here for a couple of days due to some businesses that I have to do in Chiangmai. The hotel design is chic and attractive.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is new and the location is right next to the bustling traffic junctions, surrounded by street lights and sounds. The opposite side is the "MAYA" shopping center which has hundreds of thousand of L.E.D. lights dancing around all day and night. The big screen screams the latest movies and ads. Sounds good isn't it? If you are looking for a fun and full of shopping activities stay, this hotel is just about right. But if you are looking for a quiet, serene and restful stay, then there might be a major problem. Another concerning issue is the "Privacy". My room is on 2nd floor, a Deluxe Corner room facing the inside of the hotel. Even so there is a construction activities going on since morning and last till late evening. It was so noisy and you can feel the rumble of the digging machine!!! The room glass is so clear that it is possible for the construction crew to peep through while you are having a shower in the glass-surrounded bathroom!!!. You can guess what situations would happen if your room is facing the outside shopping street.!! :( For the premium amount that the hotel charges for a room stay vs. the lack of privacy and noisy atmosphere, in my opinion, it may be questionable. If they can fix the pending issues quickly I think this hotel is a good place to enjoy.

Show more
Narong , Thailand
Shangri-La Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1104 reviews

This is my first time staying at a Shangri La. I've had friends who rave about them in other cities so I expected it to be a top notch 5 star experience.

Overall, I had a very good stay. My bed was extremely comfortable, the room was clean and spacious, I had lots of light and I could not hear the street noise even though I faced the main road. Beyond what you would expect any hotel (especially a 5 star hotel to be) I didn't think the Chiang Mai Shangri La is a 5 star accommodation based on other 5 star hotels I've stayed in Asia. Their decor was simple but seemed dated, the bathroom was basic and not the usual marble that most 5 star hotels tend to have. Perhaps if I stayed in a suite, the rooms would be built nicer but I felt like this was on par with a Marriott or Westin hotel. My biggest disappointment was the gym facilities. Their equipment could use some tuning, the eliptical machine sounded like it was going to combust if you went too fast on it and the ladies steam room was unacceptable for a 5 star hotel. The steam room was made out of plastic where there were chips, cracks and mildew

Show more
Nara , United States
The Imperial Mae Ping Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 4184 reviews

I keep coming back to this hotel because of all it's good qualities. The location is great – midway between the night bazaar and the old town, within walking distance of both.

There are lots of good restaurants, cafés, and bars nearby. The staff is very helpful and friendly. There are 4 computers downstairs if you are in need of one, and the staff can print things if necessary. There is a Tour guide company located in the lobby who helped me book a bus ride to Pai, and helped me navigate some other travel issues as well. And the pool is quite long – some of the pools in the hotel photos online are smaller than they look, but this one is long enough to actually get some good laps in. Both the hotel and the pool area have a pleasant ambience. The hotel is quite nice and reasonably priced – it's not 5-star luxury, but it is clean and has a good 3 to 4 star quality to it.

Show more
Harrison , United States
Roseate Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 1878 reviews

Front Desk 7/10 Room 6/10 Breakfast 4/10 Breakfast was all room temperature despite sterno below the serving trays.

Perhaps a bit too much water below the food? Breakfast staff did little more than clean tables and occassio0nally restock food. No interaction with customers. No coffee refills, not resetting tables with napkins and flatware. Diners had to get napkins, salt & pepper and flatware from other tables. Only egg choice was undercooked sunny side up with runny tops. Not a great selection of normal breakfast dishes. Room was in need of maintenance. Handle fell off my bathroom door. Cleaning staff ignored the handle sitting on sink. Also a cushion pad fell off the toilet seat. I retrieved and cleaned it and placed it next to door handle. Neither was fixed when I was there. Bed WAS NOT KING SIZE! It is a US Queen or smaller. My feet hung off the end of the bed. Bed & pillows were comfortable despite size. Top of the bathroom mirror was above the reach of the maids and had not been cleaned in a long time (maybe since it was installed). Otherwise, the bathroom and room were well cleaned. Room lighting was worst I have seen in ages. Only a dim light over the desk and elsewhere the ceiling lights were way too bright. I would not stay here again.

Show more
John , United States
Maninarakorn Hotel
7.6 Very good
Based on 2326 reviews

The best thing about this hotel, in my opinion, is the location. Conveniently situated between The Old City and The Night Bazaar, both are in walking distance.

There's a 7/11 (corner shop/convenience store) and an ATM right outside, as well as several restaurants and a Starbucks-type cafe. There is very little to no street noise at night, and in the daytime the road cannnot be heard from the rooms. There are always songthaews available (the cheapest way to travel) in the daytime from the front entrance. The main lobby and spa area are very nice -there are also rooms in the same building which I assume are just as nice, although I didn't stay there. A lot of rooms are situated either side of the main building, and are on top of commercial spaces (not owned by the hotel) including a nail and massage parlour and a tour booking office. We stayed in a deluxe rooom. Although it was a little out-dated, it was rather spacious and very clean. It was more like a one bed flat (apartment) than a rooom with its own little living area! The Oriental style furnishings and decor were very cute, and everything worked just fine. There was, however, a slight smell of damp in the room. The bathroom was pretty much a wetroom -typical for this part of the world. There were also no lifts in the outside buildings, although staff are very helpful and carried our things for us. Breakfast was pretty average, nothing really to say ...perhaps slightly short of choices. The pool was nice and kept very clean by staff. I saw lots of cleaning staff everywhere -the only spaces that I thought were a little unkempt were the corridors for the rooms outside the main building. Everywhere else was great in that respect. This is not a glamorous hotel, but also makes no claims to be. I assume most people come to Chiangmai for the sights and not to spend days in a hotel, and this was perfect for that ...perfectly nice pool and spa area for the odd bit of relaxation. A great budget stay. With some updatin

Show more
Alexandra , United Kingdom
BED Nimman - Adult Only
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 710 reviews

7. It's my first experience of such concept hotel, free breakfast free fruits free unlimited drinking water in the lobby and each floor, lobby like in a café, welcoming atmosphere.

Room is basic with all necessary, the hotel named itself BED, I had a higher expectation than other hotel for sleeping quality, however in my perspective, the bed is comfort but not very outstanding, average linen quality but acceptable, overall regular experience compare to other hotel. Wifi access, we stared in room #508, at most of the time, the connection is always disrupted, I have to keep switch different hotel network to try which one is working at that moment. More disappointed was next morning in the lobby, couldn't connect wifi either. As this is just one night quick stay before I going to Pai, I'll just give up report to hotel and use my own mobile data. Nearby hotel had many restaurant in great value, just make a turn to another side of the road you could find the famed iberry ice cream and cafe. We had lunch in a Japanese restaurant 5 minutes away from hotel. As in total, I appreciate the hotel concept, yet there are many things to improve.

Show more
Daniel , China
At Pingnakorn Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 3316 reviews

Worst Hotel Ever! I will never go back to this hotel. It's too noisy to get sleep at night, due to the sound of the airplane taking off and landing.

Meanwhile, the most important reason that I will not choose this hotel again it that we felt disrespectful here. We left our luggage at the hotel before we went to Phuket. The hotel staff told us that they didn't find the hairdryer in our room when we got back to pick up our luggage. They made us to open the luggage to prove our innocent. I knew it's unreasonable. But two girls in the foreign country, we had no idea how to deal with it. So, I really do not recommend this hotel. If you already book this hotel, make sure there is a hairdryer in your room.

Show more
Guan , China
Le Meridien Chiang Mai Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1560 reviews

This hotel is top notch. From the attentive staff, (and I mean all of them, doormen, front desk, cleaning staff, restaurant and bar staff.

I highly recommend them. The hotel is conveniently located in the Night Bazaar area. I originally booked next door at the Suriwongse Hotel (old hotel). I booked 4 nights and I did not feel clean. The Hotel is old and had a very bad odor. After the first night, I waked my family over and booked 3 nights at Le Meridian. I booked though Agoda and even though I prepaid once I did not feel happy and paid more money to stay at Le Meridian. The front desk person at Le Meridian was very nice. I told him of our dilemma and he got us adjoining rooms, Internet and breakfast all nights for choosing their hotel. He didn't have to do that and I felt that was just the cherry that tops an already excellent hotel. That's the service you expect. I will definitely stay again and recommend the hotel to all my business associates. I hope Agoda helps me out with an credit for the lack of oversight on the quality of the hotel. The Suriwongse is not a 4 star hotel. Sincerely George Mendoza

Show more
George , United States
Thai Akara - Lanna Boutique Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 141 reviews

The hotel is new but only a 3 star property at best. The staff are indifferent and have poor command of English.

Generally the service was average. The facilities at the hotel are poor. The swimming pool is really small and unheated. The water is permanently cold. The restaurant is not even open 24 hours but only for breakfast and lunch. The menu is limited but the food was tasty. The room service menu is limited to 3 items and subject to availability. No play room for children and the so-called library was just a small reading room with less than 10 books. The rooms and bathrooms are large and very clean. Very limited TV channels. The location was ok but difficult to find. Overall despite it being the high season in Chiang Mai the money we paid for 2 deluxe rooms with balcony was not worth it and this hotel is really overrated.

Show more
gerard , Malaysia
Furama Chiang Mai
7.6 Very good
Based on 3308 reviews

I cannot express more on my resentment towards furama hotel. This is the only hotel that i have been to with a harzadous room design.

It has sharp glass shelving edges that can cut you easily on the eye level. They placed this shelf above the coffee table where the tea and coffee sachets are placed and also a manual bin which you had to bend down to dispose rubbish. The galss shelf was place against a mirror backdrop at eye level. While i was taking a closer look at the coffee sachets, i leaned my head forward and had a deep cut on my forehead an inch away from my eye. This left an unsightly permanent scar on my forehead. This hotel is thoughtless and all the staff did after i filed a complaint was a letter and fruit platter. The bathrooms were also not working properly where sink cannot be used. Furama is not serious about their work and i will avoid at all cost and spread about their unthoughtful design. Unworthy hotel. Pls becareful of their dangerous room as it is easy to get cut.

Show more
Tan , Singapore
Sanae Hotel Chiang Mai
8.9 Excellent
Based on 639 reviews

If you are looking to be in and around the trendy Nimman Rd. and away from the Old City, then this might be a great hotel for you.

As it is within walking distance of Maya Shopping Center and lots of great hot spots in the area. Transportation options are readily available, if you prefer to venture off to the Old City for the day. Although, extremely friendly and accommodating I wouldn't say the staff spoke English. Also, when reading about wifi/internet and you need internet, be certain the hotel clearly states internet. This hotel only stated wifi; so they did it correctly, but I had no clue that there were no ethernet sockets in the rooms (no fault to hotel). It is a shared wifi; which can result in speeds from 2.52 download and .41 upload all the way up to 24.35 10.31 upload depending on the day and time.. These were my best and worst speed test results... I would always suggest setting up a vpn service; prior to or at arrival when traveling. There was an issue with hot-water; which had to wait the arrival of engineer to arrive to fix and even then it wasn't hot enough, but tolerable for my last two nights. King-size bed was EXTREMELY comfortable.. Wish I was able to take advantage of it more, but was traveling around too much to have enough bed rest; which I felt I needed after 24 hours of traveling to Thailand. I did see them working on what looked like a pool. Didn't seem quite big and mainly because they didn't have a lot of space to place it anywhere. It appears it will be setup almost as you would be driving into garage on the right.. Kind of small in size and hoping that it is separated somehow or better, just don't make it a pool and rather a nice garden with fish or some sort of sanctuary.. Too small to build and call a pool in my opinion; which doesn't appear will be complete until end of year. You can hear airplanes flying over-head, but that is just about every establishment around Nimman Rd., but you kind of get use to it. Room wa

Show more
Ulysses , United States
X2 Vibe Chiang Mai Decem Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 655 reviews

I was in Chiang Mai for a few days for a conference. I stayed at X2 Vibe on the last evening to do some souveneir shopping for the family.

I chose the X2 Vibe because of it's location to MAYA shopping mall. The mall is about seven minutes walk from the hotel, by day the walk is easy, by night the road to the mall and back is dark with very little street lighting, but still safe enough to walk. I had dinner at MAYA, so I'm unable to comment on the restaurant service and cuisine. The room is very clean and tastefully furnished. The facilities included free WiFi with a good strong signal. Tea and Coffee provided as well as two bottles of complimentary drinking water. Plenty of electrical outlets for charging the phone, tablet and laptop. The bed was in the middle of the room which was unusual, but created a very nice space around the bed to move around. There was only one chair in the room which was at the desk. Th bathroom was clean and spacious, bath gel and shampoo included. There is only a shower stall. The water pressure and hot water made having a shower very enjoyable and relaxing. It seems to be the trend to have a glass panel, instead of a solid wall so light from the bedroom filter into the bathroom. The view from my window was overlooking the neighbourhood, It wasn't particularly aesthetic but it was interesting. The staff knew their job, check-in was an easy deal, show the passport, they pull out the Agoda booking, fill in a few details and sign and it's done. At check-out they check the room and give you a nod that you're good to go, if all is OK. As the hotel is set in from the main road, transport (tuk-tuk and red seongthaews) don't regularly go past the hotel, although a few canny seongthaew drivers park near the hotel to offer transport, they quote a bit more than other roaming drivers. I'd try the hotel again, just so I could sample the restaurant and pool.

Show more
Stanley , Australia
Suriwongse Hotel
7.9 Very good
Based on 3097 reviews

As I'm typically not the one to take the time to review, I had to get this off of my chest. The first night we got to Suriwongse, you can tell right when you walked in that the hotel was outdated and you weren't going to get anything extraordinary.

First impressions are key, I had a feeling we should have just walked right out but I gave the place a chance b/c I had paid in full for 4 nights. The carpet and building smelled of rot, and in the mornings, the staff attempted to cover the smell with potpourri, but it is an impossible accomplishment. Our hotel room was nothing better. Our bathroom faucet was leaking, when we got in, the A/C was off, which made the stench unbearable, and to make things worse, all night I was itching and scratching (thinking it was just me). Come the next morning, I have bed bug bites all over my elbows, stomach and legs!!! I have never been so disgusted. The icing on the cake was the hotel breakfast buffet where we spotted cockroaches running around on the counter the cooks stand behind to make your omelets, bacon, etc. After that, we ran to our rooms and packed our bags, were able to negotiate half our money back (although I think it should have been a full refund) and booked the rest of our stay of 3 remaining nights at the Puripunn Baby Grand Boutique Hotel. While I paid significantly more to stay there, it was much needed after a day of hell at the Suriwongse. I could not have gotten out of there quicker. For those of you tossing up between this hotel and Le Meridien (or anything else close to the Night Bazaar), go for Le Meridien! I initially tried to get a room there after leaving since it was close to Night Bazaar but it was already booked. Save yourself the disappointment and do not book here.

Show more
Megan , United States
V Residence Chiang Mai
7.7 Very good
Based on 531 reviews

I really have enjoyed my stay here at the V-residence, so much in fact, that I am renting here on a monthly basis.

The staff are always available and willing to help with whatever they can. The rooms are very large, and have more than enough space to store any items you're traveling with! The bathrooms are large and have western amenities - the shower is separated and works very well! Water is clean, the air-con works wonders and the rooms stay cool even without the air-con being on constantly. There are washing machines on-site, and a restaurant will soon be opened within the building. Plenty of red truck taxis drive by all the time, and many restaurants/7-11 are within walking distance. The Malin Plaza and CMU Northgate are also within walking distance, great places to visit. I would definitely recommend staying here, and the price is very reasonable - great value for the money spent.

Show more
Stasha , United States
De Charme Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 395 reviews

Checked in with my elderly mum, but was allocated a room without lift access. We were told that we had to request for lift access when we made the booking, but nowhere on their Agoda page did they mention this.

(They have 4 blocks, only 2 blocks have lift access) Also the room they allocated was right below a room in renovation, ie constantly knocking and drilling away. We were only able to change the room the next day - but they gave a room just as bad, it was Block 2 level 4 (the said room was in the middle of the block), there was lift access but it seemed to be right below a pump/generator which made loud noises even throughout the night - as close as 2 minutes interval. Just imagine a loud deep sound vibrating in the dead silence from above you - it was impossible to sleep, and the room should not even have been issued out. To be clear, it was only the restaurant staff who were annoying - the room and maintenance staff were lovely :) The room was nice but dark, particularly where it mattered most - the luggage stand. The air conditioner was very noisy and it was serviced after we politely enquired about it, but came to the conclusion that the system was simply ancient and poorly designed. Without a remote control we were forced to get up and out of bed multiple times to turn it off and on and caused some degree of sleeplessness. The location is a little out of the way and over 1500B each way to Chiang Mai - keep that in mind if you're planning on using it as a base so plan it at the tail-end of your trip like we did. It is however near to the Elephant Nature Park (and some other less ethical parks...). The setting is serene, but we found that is was ruined by the staff's intrusiveness and the incessant music in the restaurant and some large-scale construction work. The distance is used to their advantage - the restaurant food isn't too great and very over-priced. Expect western prices for sub-par food. Stay for free breakfast, but eat at the resto on the street 100m up the road for a much better meal at a more reasonable price :). To avoid the extortive charges from the mini bar, you can also buy beer, water and other snacks from there at a sensible price. Only two small bottles of water are provided per person per day

This is a fabulous luxury hotel in a great location on the river with a lot of traditional Thai character--just what you would want in Chiang Mai.

Rooms were palatial and grand with beautiful decor, the grounds and pool areas were gorgeous, and the breakfast was great. Our only complaint is that the hotel is surprisingly not well-equipped for families. We stayed in a beautiful two-room suite with our young children, but despite the massive living room and theoretically perfect set-up for a family, the rooms are not equipped with sofabeds or day beds (only a large traditional couch), leaving rollaway beds as the only option. The hotel really sticks it to its guests in this regard, because it charges an absolute fortune for each rollaway (1700 THB, or around US $60 per night, per rollaway!). This is an obscene amount of money for a rollaway, even for Europe or the US, so being charged this much in Thailand when there is no other option for young children is really a crime. As young kids under age 7 obviously cannot stay in their own room, and there are no adjoining rooms, it's really surprising and just plain wrong to charge this much to accommodate a family in a room that is plainly large enough for one. Every other hotel we've ever stayed in, both in Thailand and elsewhere, offers sofa beds or some other accomodation for young kids. If rollaways are the only option, they should at least be reasonable, and not abused as a way to penalize a family with young kids. Other than this, the hotel was fantastic. If it would only make some effort to be more family-friendly, it could well be among the top hotels in Chiang Mai.

this little guest house was a brilliant find. it was clean and comfortable, providing all the basics necessary at a very reasonable cost.

what made our stay particularly special were the brother and sister hosts, they were so helpful, polite and attentive throughout our stay, giving us advice on where to visit, booking taxis and making sure everything was to our liking. the pretty little courtyard/garden was a wonderful little haven to eat breakfast each morning. unfortunately on our last day of our trip in chiang mai my husband accidently left his bag containing our passports, money and driving licences on a songthaew that had dropped us off at the airport. we rang the guesthouse for help and they immediately rang the songthaew company for us. thankfully they were able to track down the driver who said he had our bag but was stuck in traffic, so the lovely gentleman from the guesthouse drove his moped to pick up our bag and then drove it all the way out to the airport do deliver the bag to us. i can't tell you how helpful and generous this person was to assist us from a situation that could have ruined our whole stay in thailand. if we come back to thailand we will definitely stay here again and cannot recommend this guesthouse more highly.

We're a retired Canadian couple that loved our 7 night stay at Fuengfa Place. This hotel is in the old city and about a 25 to 30 min.

walk to the markets, back packer area or less than 10 by tuk tuk. This area is not as congested as the back packer area and there are lots of eateries, coffee shops food stalls in the immediate area. The hotel has a very nice restaurant/bar area and serve a western breakfast, which was fine, we chose to eat most often from the street vendors, just a personal preference. The owners and staff take great pride in hosting their guests, we couldn't have been treated better. The premises are spotless as was our room. A/c and wifi worked well and we felt the room rate was fairly priced. We met a fellow there who has lived in Chaing Mia for 10 yrs, the first 9 years were at this hotel, we thought that was a pretty good recommendation. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and without question stay there again should we return to Chiang Mia.

I was greeted my name as soon as I got out of my airport taxi, which was a welcome sight after 30+ hours of travelling! Jon is incredibly friendly and I felt at ease immediately.

Jon suggested an awesome restaurant nearby where I grabbed dinner, and then booked me in for a cooking class a few hours later. Super easy! I had a wonderful pancake breakfast the next morning, and it was lovely just to chill out with a coffee in the garden and watch the people walk by. Elizabeth , United States
Galare Guest House
8.2 Excellent
Based on 731 reviews

It was my first stay in Chiang Mai. I was afraid of being too far from the main attractions, i.e. the old city and the temples.

Those fears disappeared the first day. Actually the old city has nothing peculiar, it's not like the old city of Lijiang for instance where the architecture contrasts with the new city. In that way, Chiang Mai city itself is kind of disappointing. It's a succession of spa, guest house and temples. So being in Galare, a 15 min walk from the old city, you won't miss anything. Especially since at night, the old city turns quiet and empty and all the action is in the night market, which is 2 min walk from Galare. If you come to Chiang-Mai, all the action is around the city, in the mountain so Galare location is in fact great for its value. The personel is nice and the laundry cheap. If you're staying for a long time, you can even wash your clothes nearby by the kilog for 30 bahts. We had continetal breakfast there which is good but the omelette was too oily for me. Price is not cheap too. But anyway, we loved to eat at different places. For diner, when you get out of the alley, take a left and you'll find a restaurant "La-own" on the right side of the street next to an Italian restaurant. The food is simple but very tasty, the best we had in Chiang-Mai.

Fantastic location right next to the Saturday market, just up a side street so it is nice and quiet especially in the evening.

There's a lovely older woman that sells roasted banana skewers at the street corner for 10 baht. The wonderful hostess came to the street to wave us goodbye. This is seriously one of my favorite places I've ever stayed!

Even though there wasn't a review of this hotel yet I thought I gave it a try since it was only for a night and it's new and near the airport.

At first it was hard to find, I was driving my Thai friend's car and had to call up to ask for directions. it's tucked underneath the more prominent Airport Place Apartments. Strange arrangement, since it looked like M1 had only one floor and about 6 rooms to it name. THe decor is stylish boutique style. Rooms are big and clean. There's no restaurant but you can help yourself to the snacks, cup noodles and coffee outside. Wifi is free but a chore to log in again every time you leave your phone or pc idling or come back in the room. The glass door to the hotel is locked at 6pm but your room key has a magnetic thingy to open it. When I checked out next morning at around 8.30am the door was still shut and so was the reception area! There was a lady sweeping the floor and she told me it was ok to just leave. Luckily I had prepaid. Obviously there was no breakfast even though the agoda booking mentioned breakfast included. I guess it meant the cup noodles. Location wise, after you've found it, is convenient if you want to stay near the airport and Central Mall, which is a 5 minute walk away. You can walk there and catch a tuk tuk to town or try and catch one outside the soi (150THB to the night market). When coming back tell the tuk tuk driver Airport Place Apartment and he'll get you there. It's under the overhead pass next to the large Toyota Sure showroom on Mahidol Road. Will stay here again.

Pleasantly surprised at the nice location, close to local market where many Thai cooking classes shop, facilities for massage, laundry, interesting small cafes/restaurants, both local and modern shops.

Only downside, up on 3rd floor, no elevator but staff quite readily brought luggage up and down; breakfast not included, but available. Our stay at the arte house was amazing! I will definitely come back to this place the next time I'm in chiang Mai.

The owner bob is so friendly and welcoming. He seems to be working there most of the time. And the whole vibe of the place is very chill and relaxed. You take your shoes off at the entrance which makes you feel like you're entering someone's home. Nice wood floors everywhere. Our room was small but cozy and cute like the rest of the place, and also very clean. The way the light comes through the windows makes it the perfect place to relax. For the price, this was way better than I could've expected. Also great location within walking distance of a bunch I stuff, especially if you're in town for the Loy krathong festival. The only improvements I would suggest would be sealing the windows a little better to prevent Mosquitos from getting in! Other than that, this place was perfect and exactly what we were looking for.

Traveler impressions of Chiang Mai

Chiang Mai is quite a pleasant city but with a lot of traffic during day time. The area within the old city walls are good to walk around absorbing the city life and visiting numerous temples.

There are also a couple of museums. This city has a lot of history and culture.

Show more
Seneviratne ,Australia

A very different city compared to Bangkok. People are much friendlier and have a very different attitude towards tourists.

More about Chiang Mai

Located in the north of Thailand, Chiang Mai is the country’s second largest and second oldest city. As such, it provides an excellent base from which to discover the culture of Thailand. Hundreds of temples are scattered throughout, and anywhere visitors go, they are sure to see pagodas peeking up over the tree line. Visible from all over the city, Doi Suthep Mountain features the most dignified temple of the area on the fringe of the city center.

Shopping is certainly an option here, especially for those looking for handicrafts, delicate carvings, silk, and original artwork. Other than the typical tourist finds of shopping and popular sites, guests can also really immerse themselves in the city by enrolling in cooking, language, yoga, or massage classes. Guided meditation retreats to mountain monasteries, trips to conservation projects such as the Elephant Nature Park, and homestays in remote hill-tribe villages are also very popular for visitors of Chiang Mai.

In the evenings, international restaurants and nightclubs can be found throughout the town. Riverside clubs, the hostess bars of Loy Kroh, and the ultra-chic lounges on Nimmanhemin Road all provide fantastic opportunities to celebrate the memorable experiences gained while in Chiang Mai.

Those traveling to Chiang Mai will be served by Chiang Mai International Airport.

Be sure to check out the interactive map of Chiang Mai for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

Our room was really spacious, and the bathroom was as big as my bedroom back home in London - yet the furniture and the shower, bath tub and washing basin were decidedly decrepit, although functioning. The staff are efficient and friendly, but not particularly accurate: for example, the concierge made sure to have our luggage delivered to our room while we completed the check in (which was nice and much appreciated), but then, as I entered the room and decided to make myself a cup of tea, I realised that the cups were sticky and had not been washed properly! Show more Maddalena , United Kingdom U Nimman Chiang Mai 9 Excellent Based on 291 reviews I stay here for a couple of days due to some businesses that I have to do in Chiangmai. The hotel design is chic and attractive. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is new and the location is right next to the bustling traffic junctions, surrounded by street lights and sounds. The opposite side is the "MAYA" shopping center which has hundreds of thousand of L.E.D. lights dancing around all day and night. The big screen screams the latest movies and ads. Sounds good isn't it? If you are looking for a fun and full of shopping activities stay, this hotel is just about right. But if you are looking for a quiet, serene and restful stay, then there might be a major problem. Another concerning issue is the "Privacy". My room is on 2nd floor, a Deluxe Corner room facing the inside of the hotel. Even so there is a construction activities going on since morning and last till late evening. It was so noisy and you can feel the rumble of the digging machine!!! The room glass is so clear that it is possible for the construction crew to peep through while you are having a shower in the glass-surrounded bathroom!!!. You can guess what situations would happen if your room is facing the outside shopping street.!! :( For the premium amount that the hotel charges for a room stay vs. the lack of privacy and noisy atmosphere, in my opinion, it may be questionable. If they can fix the pending issues quickly I think this hotel is a good place to enjoy. My bed was extremely comfortable, the room was clean and spacious, I had lots of light and I could not hear the street noise even though I faced the main road. Their decor was simple but seemed dated, the bathroom was basic and not the usual marble that most 5 star hotels tend to have. Perhaps if I stayed in a suite, the rooms would be built nicer but I felt like this was on par with a Marriott or Westin hotel. My biggest disappointment was the gym facilities. Their equipment could use some tuning, the eliptical machine sounded like it was going to combust if you went too fast on it and the ladies steam room was unacceptable for a 5 star hotel. Show more John , United States Maninarakorn Hotel 7.6 Very good Based on 2326 reviews The best thing about this hotel, in my opinion, is the location. Conveniently situated between The Old City and The Night Bazaar, both are in walking distance. There's a 7/11 (corner shop/convenience store) and an ATM right outside, as well as several restaurants and a Starbucks-type cafe. There is very little to no street noise at night, and in the daytime the road cannnot be heard from the rooms. There are always songthaews available (the cheapest way to travel) in the daytime from the front entrance. The main lobby and spa area are very nice -there are also rooms in the same building which I assume are just as nice, although I didn't stay there. A lot of rooms are situated either side of the main building, and are on top of commercial spaces (not owned by the hotel) including a nail and massage parlour and a tour booking office. We stayed in a deluxe rooom. Although it was a little out-dated, it was rather spacious and very clean. It was more like a one bed flat (apartment) than a rooom with its own little living area! The Oriental style furnishings and decor were very cute, and everything worked just fine. There was, however, a slight smell of damp in the room. The bathroom was pretty much a wetroom -typical for this part of the world. There were also no lifts in the outside buildings, although staff are very helpful and carried our things for us. Breakfast was pretty average, nothing really to say ...perhaps slightly short of choices. The pool was nice and kept very clean by staff. I saw lots of cleaning staff everywhere -the only spaces that I thought were a little unkempt were the corridors for the rooms outside the main building. Everywhere else was great in that respect. This is not a glamorous hotel, but also makes no claims to be. I assume most people come to Chiangmai for the sights and not to spend days in a hotel, and this was perfect for that ...perfectly nice pool and spa area for the odd bit of relaxation. Show more Yuenyong ,Thailand Discover the neighborhoods of Chiang Mai Old City 922 hotels Nimmanhemin 393 hotels Huay Kaew 379 hotels Chiang Mai Airport 254 hotels Hang Dong 224 hotels Mae Rim 207 hotels Tha Phae 197 hotels Charoenmueng 192 hotels Night Bazaar 190 hotels Chang Khlan 189 hotels Wua Lai 167 hotels San Sai 137 hotels Su Thep 134 hotels Chang Phuak 126 hotels Chiang Mai Riverside 115 hotels Doi Saket 103 hotels Tha Sala 103 hotels Chang Moi 80 hotels Mae Taeng 65 hotels San Phe Suea 58 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Guest Houses in Chiang Mai 673 Apartments in Chiang Mai 315 Hostels in Chiang Mai 313 Resorts in Chiang Mai 264 Serviced Apartments in Chiang Mai 120 Bungalows in Chiang Mai 19 Capsule Hotels in Chiang Mai 4 Ryokans in Chiang Mai 1 More about Chiang Mai Located in the north of Thailand, Chiang Mai is the country’s second largest and second oldest city. As such, it provides an excellent base from which to discover the culture of Thailand. Hundreds of temples are scattered throughout, and anywhere visitors go, they are sure to see pagodas peeking up over the tree line. Visible from all over the city, Doi Suthep Mountain features the most dignified temple of the area on the fringe of the city center. Shopping is certainly an option here, especially for those looking for handicrafts, delicate carvings, silk, and original artwork. Other than the typical tourist finds of shopping and popular sites, guests can also really immerse themselves in the city by enrolling in cooking, language, yoga, or massage classes. Guided meditation retreats to mountain monasteries, trips to conservation projects such as the Elephant Nature Park, and homestays in remote hill-tribe villages are also very popular for visitors of Chiang Mai. In the evenings, international restaurants and nightclubs can be found throughout the town. Riverside clubs, the hostess bars of Loy Kroh, and the ultra-chic lounges on Nimmanhemin Road all provide fantastic opportunities to celebrate the memorable experiences gained while in Chiang Mai. Those traveling to Chiang Mai will be served by Chiang Mai International Airport . Be sure to check out the interactive map of Chiang Mai for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.
